main event: A single, silvery-colored object about 25 feet long with a vapor trail was observed by ground radar and visually by witnesses for over 2 hours on November 6, 1962 near Little Rock, Arkansas.
interesting points: The object was tracked on radar but could not be definitively identified.
The sighting was part of 'Operation Firefly', a program to obtain visual observations of objects.
The object disappeared from view as the sun rose.
The object was estimated to be at an elevation of about 25 degrees to the southeast.
No interception or identification action was taken, and no known air traffic was in the area.
sighted object: A single, silvery-colored object about 25 feet long with a vapor trail
photographs: No, the report does not include any photographs
